# [Legal Background]{.primary} {background-color=#00ddff}

## Criminal and Civil Cases

In the Canadian Justice System, there are two forms of legal proceedings; [civil law]{.secondary} and [criminal law]{.secondary}.

::::: panel-tabset

### Criminal Law

::: {style="font-size: 80%;"}

- The defendant is [presumed innocent until proven guilty]{.tertiary} of a criminal act
- The burden of proof is on the prosecution to prove that the defendant is guilty [beyond a reasonable doubt]{.tertiary}

![](https://gallery.yopriceville.com/var/albums/Free-Clipart-Pictures/Police-PNG/Handcuffs_PNG_Clip_Art_Image.png?m=1448078102){.absolute bottom=0 right=0 width=400}
:::

### Civil Law

::: {style="font-size: 80%;"}

- The defendant is accused of causing harm and/or damages through their actions
- The plaintiff must show that the defendant is *probably* liable for daamges based on a [balance of probabilities]{.tertiary}

![](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/TsnJntoLvk4/maxresdefault.jpg){.absolute bottom=0 right=0 width=400}
:::
